result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No violent or abusive contact with the party/parties named in the bail bond. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

4:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Lee Gast in court.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for David Lee Gast.  Defense filed a letter from the victim wanting to have contact with the Deft. Victim stated she wishes for case to be dropped. State- case is premature, imposes modification of bond. Atty Rock doesn't feel the need to have the no contact order, requests it to be lifted. Court modifies bond to have no violent or abusive contact with victim.
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
